item.title: Loscar Hotel London 2-6 Southampton Row, London WC1B 4AA, United Kingdom, 2nd December
item.description:
Dear Camden Team, Since I joined Loscar as Security Manager, we have experienced multiple near-miss accidents caused by the tripping hazard shown in the attached photograph. We have been fortunate that none of these incidents have resulted in serious injuries; however, the risk remains significant. It is evident that the pavement on the opposite property has been raised so that the entrance aligns seamlessly with the pavement, thereby eliminating any tripping hazard. In contrast, our property was not provided with a raised pavement, leaving us with an uneven surface that continues to pose a risk to guests, staff, and visitors. We have held several internal meetings with our maintenance team to explore possible solutions. Unfortunately, due to the buildingâ€™s Grade II listed status, our ability to make modifications are limited. I kindly request your assistance in reviewing this matter and advising us on how you can help us effectively minimise the likelihood of a serious accident. At present, our doorman is verbally warning guests to take care around the step; however, this is not a sustainable or adequate long-term solution. We would greatly appreciate any support in ensuring the safety and well-being of everyone who visits our property is of utmost importance to us, and your cooperation in helping us reduce this risk would be sincerely valued.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsway, Holborn, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large advertising pole, 2nd December
item.description:
A property have recently had their driveway improved and the company that done this have erected a large metal pole with a flag advertising their company, this is on the pavement and has already been there for 2 weeks. yesterday in the strong winds the pole blew over as residents son was passing it and it has hit is face and he is now in hospital, this is a dangerous hazard and needs removing before another accident happens.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 62, Foots Cray Lane, Albany Park, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
